subject: Relationships
title: Repair Attempts: Saving the Argument
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Repair Attempts: Saving the Argument.

hook.text: Mid-argument, she makes a silly face. He laughs despite himself. That laugh just saved their relationship.

buildup.text: Repair attempts are any effort to de-escalate tension: humor, touch, apology, or changing the subject.

discovery.text: Gottman says the success of repair attempts â€” not the absence of conflict â€” predicts relationship survival.

twist.text: In unhappy relationships, even genuine repair attempts are rejected. The emotional climate blocks reception.

climax.text: The ability to accept a partner's olive branch matters more than who was right in the argument.

punchline.text: A silly face mid-fight can save a relationship. Repair is everything.

quiz.question: What predicts relationship survival according to Gottman?
options: The success of repair attempts during conflict
